body_html: Alright, so here I have one more question. If I have a model with specific operators, which gradients have not been implemented in C++ version, does it mean that during training it's gonna fail? Or it's silently continue execution with no update on the variables? I'm asking this because I'm trying to validate how much using C++ interface is practical for training models!

body: Alright, so here I have one more question. If I have a model with specific operators, which gradients have not been implemented in C++ version, does it mean that during training it's gonna fail? Or it's silently continue execution with no update on the variables? I'm asking this because I'm trying to validate how much using C++ interface is practical for training models!
